channel.title: BBC News - England
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Harry Dunn: Liz Truss raises case with US at United Nations Assembly
item.description: Foreign Secretary Liz Truss speaks to the US Secretary of State about "delivering justice".

item.title: Police continue to question man over child deaths
item.description: Terri Harris and her children Lacey and John Paul were found dead with Lacey's friend Connie Gent.

item.title: Arundel Castle: Man arrested over Mary Queen of Scots rosary theft
item.description: More than Â£1m of gold and silver historical artefacts were stolen in May.

item.title: Salisbury poisonings: Third man faces charges for Novichok attack
item.description: Denis Sergeev is thought to have been the on-the-ground commander for the 2018 poisonings.

item.title: M25 protests: Arrests made as Insulate Britain blocks motorway
item.description: Insulate Britain protesters blocked traffic on both carriageways of the motorway in Surrey.

item.title: County Championship: Match halted as air ambulance swoops in
item.description: Play between Gloucestershire and Durham was stopped as the helicopter landed on the pitch.

item.title: Cleveland PCC Steve Turner accused of theft by MP
item.description: MP Andy McDonald uses parliamentary privilege to claim Steve Turner was sacked by a former employer.

item.title: Thomas Rogers: Brothers convicted of killing younger sibling
item.description: A family feud leads to the death of Thomas Rogers at the hands of David and Samuel Rogers.

item.title: HMYOI Aylesbury declares itself Covid outbreak site
item.description: The young offender institution says a "high number" of inmates have tested positive for Covid-19.

item.title: Drink driver's erratic journey captured on his own dashcam
item.description: Footage shows David Leahy knocking down a street sign, mounting kerbs and hitting a parked car.

item.title: Devon food bank sees 26-year-old coffee packet handed in
item.description: Staff at the Kingsbridge Food Bank said any out-of-date items were "tricky" to dispose of.

item.title: Lillie's virtual Ben Nevis fundraising challenge
item.description: The 10-year-old with cerebral palsy is covering the length of a mountain trail at home.

item.title: Ipswich runner Millie King: 'You've got to be the best you can be'
item.description: The 16-year-old sprinter gets two England call-ups after focusing on training during the pandemic.

item.title: Baby squirrel abandoned on Cambridge patio bonds with carer
item.description: The squirrel, named Paquito, formed an unexpected friendship with his temporary carer.

item.title: Salford woman shares photographs of eczema flare-ups
item.description: Kymmene Dawson shares photographs of stages of eczema flare-ups to raise awareness of the condition.

item.title: 'Dachshund disco is a children's party for your dog'
item.description: Organisers James Morgan and Anushka Fernando want to help dogs socialise again after lockdown.

item.title: Suffolk Trading Standards seizes illegal cigarettes found in manhole
item.description: A tobacco detection dog makes the discovery as trading standards officers conduct raids on shops.

item.title: Gateshead traffic gridlock prompts urgent investigation
item.description: Gateshead Council says it is looking into last week's congestion as "a matter of urgency".

item.title: Bluebird: Campbell's daughter says craft will return to Coniston Water
item.description: The original parts are to be returned to a Coniston museum after its restoration was taken apart.

item.title: Jones makes major changes to England squad
item.description: Billy and Mako Vunipola plus George Ford are left out of a 45-man squad as eight uncapped players including Louis Lynagh are called up.

item.title: Anthony Joshua v Oleksandr Usyk: Ukrainian 'jumping in at deep end' with world heavyweight title bid
item.description: Anthony Joshua commends Oleksandr Usyk for "jumping in at the deep end" with a world heavyweight title tilt after just two fights in the class.

item.title: Steve Cooper: Nottingham Forest appoint ex-Swansea City boss after agreeing compensation
item.description: Nottingham Forest appoint Steve Cooper as head coach after they agree compensation with former club Swansea City.
